body_html:
@gunan

without entering anything manually.

That's the issue, actually. If you need to enter it manually interactively in ./configure - it will fail. Something in this command relies on defined environment variables:

bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

@r4nt

can you put
echo $TF_NEED_CUDA

it echoes '1', which is good
but again, those vars are not inherited in bazel build

body:
@gunan
> without entering anything manually.

That's the issue, actually. If you need to enter it manually interactively in ./configure - it will fail. Something in this command relies on defined environment variables:
```
bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
```
@r4nt 
> can you put
echo $TF_NEED_CUDA

it echoes '1', which is good
but again, those vars are not inherited in `bazel build`
